faqs.question: Are the Begin classes right for me?
faqs.answer: The Begin classes are suitable for any student new to yoga or new to the Iyengar method of yoga. They are also great for anyone coming back to yoga after a break. The Begin classes are designed to introduce students to the foundations of the Iyengar method, with emphasis on precision, alignment, and timing.

faqs.question: Do I need to book into the classes I want to attend?
faqs.answer: Yes, booking ensures that the class has availability. Importantly, you will also be notified if the class needs to be cancelled.

faqs.question: Can I do a class if I have an injury?
faqs.answer: The classes are designed for students who are generally well and do not present with chronic injuries or illness. Stiffness is not a problem, nor are injuries that still allow you to move freely — just be sure to advise your teacher of any issues at the beginning of the class.

faqs.question: What equipment do I need to bring to a yoga class?
faqs.answer: Just bring yourself. All props and equipment needed for the class are provided, although you are welcome to bring your own mat if you prefer.

faqs.question: Do you have change rooms?
faqs.answer: Yes. We have a bathroom that can be used as a change room.

faqs.question: I have a more significant injury or illness but I really want to start yoga – what should I do?
faqs.answer: Book into our Yoga Therapy – Personal class. For those with serious injuries or illnesses, Yoga Therapy classes provide one-on-one attention and guidance to safely begin yoga practice.

faqs.question: I would like to put a pause on my Direct Debit – how do I do it?
faqs.answer: We can make changes to your Direct Debit, including changing your pass or pausing payments while you are away. Important Terms and Conditions: You may suspend your pass if you are on holiday, travelling for business, or unable to practice due to serious illness or injury. Seven days notice by email is required prior to any pass suspension date. Minimum suspension period is 1 week, and suspensions must occur in one-week blocks. You may suspend your pass up to three times per year.

faqs.question: Do you have pre-natal classes?
faqs.answer: No. We do not recommend starting yoga at the Centre once you become pregnant. However, pregnant students who have been long-term participants may continue their practice under guidance.

faqs.question: Can I continue with Yoga if I become pregnant?
faqs.answer: Yes. Existing students with an established relationship with our senior teachers can continue yoga during pregnancy. Our senior teachers are trained and experienced in guiding students safely.

faqs.question: If I go on holidays or injure myself, can I pause my membership?
faqs.answer: Yes. A minimum of 7 days notice in writing is required for all changes (temporary or permanent) to your pass.

faqs.question: I couldn’t attend the course or workshop I booked. Can I get a refund?
faqs.answer: We understand that life can get in the way. Please advise us via email as soon as possible if you are unable to attend. All refunds incur a $30 administration fee.
